Class SuperHero

java.lang.Object
  prac02_ex3.SuperHero
All Implemented Interfaces:
Hero
Direct Known Subclasses:
EnhancedHuman, Human, SuperHuman
public abstract class SuperHero
extends java.lang.Object
implements Hero

A superhero is a hero (with two identities) but may also have superpowers.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Colin Fidge

Constructor Summary
SuperHero(java.lang.String trueIdentity, java.lang.String alterEgo)
          When first born a superhero has a particular identity, but has the ability to change identities.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.String currentIdentity()
          Returns the hero's current identity in a printable format.
abstract  boolean hasPower(SuperPower queriedPower)
          Tests to see whether or not the superhero currently has the queried superpower.
 void switchIdentity()
          Switches the hero's current identity to their alter ego.
abstract  int totalPower()
          Returns the superhero's current "total power" which is the sum of the numerical values associated with all of his/her currently-held powers.
